verses.verse: Shiggaion <WH7692> of David, <WH1732> which <WH834> he sang <WH7891> unto the LORD, <WH3068> concerning <WH5921> the words <WH1697> of Cush <WH3568> the Benjamite. <WH1145> O LORD <WH3068> my God, <WH430> in you do I put my trust: <WH2620> save <WH3467> me from all <WH3605> them that persecute <WH7291> me, and deliver <WH5337> me:
Lest <WH6435> he tear <WH2963> my soul <WH5315> like a lion, <WH738> rending <WH6561> it in pieces, while there is none <WH369> to deliver. <WH5337>
O LORD <WH3068> my God, <WH430> if <WH518> I have done <WH6213> this; <WH2063> if <WH518> there be iniquity <WH5766> in my hands; <WH3709>
If <WH518> I have rewarded <WH1580> evil <WH7451> to him that was at peace <WH7999> with me; (yes, I have delivered <WH2502> him that without <WH7387> cause <WH7387> is my enemy: <WH6887>)

Let the enemy <WH341> persecute <WH7291> my soul, <WH5315> and take <WH5381> it; yes, let him tread <WH7429> down my life <WH2416> on the earth, <WH776> and lay <WH7931> my honor <WH3519> in the dust. <WH6083> Selah. <WH5542>

Arise, <WH6965> O LORD, <WH3068> in your anger, <WH639> lift <WH5375> up yourself because of the rage <WH5678> of my enemies: <WH6887> and awake <WH5782> for me to the judgment <WH4941> that you have commanded. <WH6680>
So shall the congregation <WH5712> of the people <WH3816> compass <WH5437> you about: for their sakes <WH5921> therefore return <WH7725> you on high. <WH4791>
The LORD <WH3068> shall judge <WH1777> the people: <WH5971> judge <WH8199> me, O LORD, <WH3068> according to my righteousness, <WH6664> and according to my integrity <WH8537> that is in me.

Oh <WH4994> let the wickedness <WH7451> of the wicked <WH7563> come to an end; <WH1584> but establish <WH3559> the just: <WH6662> for the righteous <WH6662> God <WH430> tries <WH974> the hearts <WH3826> and reins. <WH3629>
My defense <WH4043> is of God, <WH430> which saves <WH3467> the upright <WH3477> in heart. <WH3820>
God <WH430> judges <WH8199> the righteous, <WH6662> and God <WH410> is angry <WH2194> with the wicked every <WH3605> day. <WH3117>
If <WH518> he turn <WH7725> not, he will whet <WH3913> his sword; <WH2719> he has bent <WH1869> his bow, <WH7198> and made it ready. <WH3559>
He has also prepared <WH3559> for him the instruments <WH3627> of death; <WH4194> he ordains <WH6466> his arrows <WH2671> against the persecutors. <WH1814>
Behold, <WH2009> he travails <WH2254> with iniquity, <WH205> and has conceived <WH2029> mischief, <WH5999> and brought <WH3205> forth <WH3205> falsehood. <WH8267>
He made <WH3738> a pit, <WH953> and dig <WH2658> it, and is fallen <WH5307> into the ditch <WH7845> which he made. <WH6466>
His mischief <WH5999> shall return <WH7725> on his own head, <WH7218> and his violent <WH2555> dealing shall come <WH3381> down <WH3381> on his own pate. <WH6936>
I will praise <WH3034> the LORD <WH3068> according to his righteousness: <WH6664> and will sing praise to the name <WH8034> of the LORD <WH3068> most <WH5945> high. <WH5945>
